extendedIngredients.name: beef

extendedIngredients.name: mirin

title: Ramen with ponzu sauce
summary: The recipe Ramen with ponzu sauce could satisfy your Japanese craving in roughly 45 minutes. Watching your figure? This dairy free recipe has 636 calories, 28g of protein, and 13g of fat per serving. For $47.66 per serving, this recipe covers 20% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It works well as an expensive main course. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. Head to the store and pick up citrus juice, ponzu sauce, kombu, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the juice you could follow this main course with the Fruit Juice Pops as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 35%. This score is rather bad. Similar recipes include How to cook: Ramen with ponzu sauce, Ponzu Sauce, and Ponzu Sauce.

winePairing.pairingText: Riesling, Sake, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Ramen Noodles. Saké is an obvious choice when it comes to Japanese food. If you want to stick to grape wine, though, you might opt for sauvignon blanc or riesling. You could try Alsace Willm Kirchberg de Barr Riesling. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.8 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 24 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Alsace Willm Kirchberg de Barr Riesling
productMatches.description: The Grand Cru Kirchberg de Barr is one of the most renowned Grands Crus of Alsace, which gives rise to Riesling of great character. The terroir is deep, giving wines excellent structure, freshness and unparalleled aromatic intensity. Over time, these wines gain particularly in complexity, finesse and minerality.

instructions: InstructionsThose are kombu and bonito flakes in the photo. For further discussion, please refer to the how to make dashi entry as ponzu sauce starts with dashi.Place the dashi in a pot. If using water, place the water in the pot and add the bonito flakes and kombu. Add the soy sauce.Pour in the rice vinegar…… citrus juice and mirin. Boil everything together, uncovered, for about 20 minutes. Cool and strain.To assemble your ramen with ponzu sauce, place the cooked ramen in a bowl and top with the sliced meat and vegetables. Pour in the ponzu sauce. If you want your noodle soup hot, reheat the required amount of ponzu sauce before use.

steps.step: Those are kombu and bonito flakes in the photo. For further discussion, please refer to the how to make dashi entry as ponzu sauce starts with dashi.
Place the dashi in a pot. If using water, place the water in the pot and add the bonito flakes and kombu.

Pour in the rice vinegar…… citrus juice and mirin. Boil everything together, uncovered, for about 20 minutes. Cool and strain.To assemble your ramen with ponzu sauce, place the cooked ramen in a bowl and top with the sliced meat and vegetables.
Pour in the ponzu sauce. If you want your noodle soup hot, reheat the required amount of ponzu sauce before use.
